trans-unit.source: Plays a media file.
If the media is a video file, the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.VideoDrawing"></xref> draws it to the specified rectangle.

Although you can declare an instance of this class in [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xaml](~/includes/tla2sharptla-xaml-md.md)], you cannot load and play its media without using code, because of the dependency on the <xref:System.Windows.Media.MediaPlayer> class and in particular the <xref:System.Windows.Media.MediaPlayer.Open%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Media.MediaPlayer.Play%2A> methods.
To play media in [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_xaml](~/includes/tla2sharptla-xaml-md.md)] only, use a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.MediaElement>.
Despite its name, a <xref:System.Windows.Media.VideoDrawing> can be used to play audio.

**Performance Note:** A <xref:System.Windows.Media.VideoDrawing> provides fewer features then an <xref:System.Windows.Controls.MediaElement>: <xref:System.Windows.Media.VideoDrawing> does not support layout, input, or focus.

However, because it does not support these features, <xref:System.Windows.Media.VideoDrawing> provides performance benefits making them ideal for describing backgrounds, clip art, and for low-level drawing with <xref:System.Windows.Media.Visual> objects.
See [Drawing Objects Overview](~/docs/framework/wpf/graphics-multimedia/drawing-objects-overview.md) for more information.
An <xref:System.Windows.Media.VideoDrawing> is a type of <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> object and therefore can be frozen to improve performance.
For information about <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> features, such as freezing and cloning, see the [Freezable Objects Overview](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/freezable-objects-overview.md).
Initializes a new instance of the VideoDrawing class.
Creates a modifiable clone of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.VideoDrawing"></xref>, making deep copies of this object's values.
When copying dependency properties, this method copies resource references and data bindings (but they might no longer resolve) but not animations or their current values.
This method is used to produce modifiable copies of frozen <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> objects (or any <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> object).
For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version with a strongly typed implementation.
For more information, see <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.Clone%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
A modifiable clone of the current object.
The cloned object's <xref href="System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen"></xref> property will be `false` even if the source's <xref href="System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen"></xref> property was `true.`
Creates a modifiable clone of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.VideoDrawing"></xref> object, making deep copies of this object's current values.
Resource references, data bindings, and animations are not copied, but their current values are.
This method is used to produce modifiable copies of frozen <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> objects (or any <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> object).
For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version with a strongly typed implementation.
For more information, see <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.CloneCurrentValue%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
A modifiable clone of the current object.
The cloned object's <xref href="System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen"></xref> property will be `false` even if the source's <xref href="System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen"></xref> property was `true`.
Gets or sets the media player associated with the drawing.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None
The media player associated with the drawing.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.VideoDrawing.Player"></xref> dependency property.
Gets or sets the rectangular area in which the video is drawn.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None
The rectangle in which the video is drawn.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.VideoDrawing.Rect"></xref> dependency property.
